#summary irrb Utilities (iwalktest, imeshcvt)

== Introduction ==

The utilities *iwalktest* and *imeshcvt* may be optionally installed to enhance the 
functionality of *[http://code.google.com/p/tubras/wiki/irrb irrb]*.

*iwalktest* is used to view exported Blender scenes.
*imeshcvt* is used to convert meshes to a binary format (.irrbmesh).

== Installation == 

The latest stable download of *irrbUtilities* is accessible from both the "Project" and "Downloads" tabs of this Google Code project. On the "Projects" tab, *irrbUtilties* is listed in the "Featured Downloads" section.

The current "beta" version is 0.2. It may be downloaded from here: 

[http://tubras.googlecode.com/files/irrbutils-0.2.zip irrbutils-0.2.zip]

The contents of the zip package are:

{{{
 iwalktest.exe   // windows executable
 iwalktest       // linux executable
 iwalktest.cfg   // iwalktest configuration files
 imeshcvt.exe    // windows executable
 imeshcvt        // linux executable
 Irrlicht.dll    // irrlicht dll
 irrKlang.dll    // irrklang dll
 ikpMP3.dll      // irrklang dll
 data/fnt/defaults.zip   // fonts used by iwalktest
}}}
 
Unzip the contents to a user *writable* directory because *iwalktest* creates a log file in the directory it is executed from.

*Windows* users will also need the [http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=200b2fd9-ae1a-4a14-984d-389c36f85647&displaylang=en  Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable Package (x86)] installed.

*Linux* users - researching...

== Configuration ==

In order to integrate *iwalktest* and *imeshcvt* with *irrb*, you need to set up environment variables which point to the locations of their respective executables.

*Windows*
If installed/unzipped to "c:\irrbutils", then you would set the following environment variables:

{{{
 IWALKTEST=c:\irrbutils\iwalktest.exe
 IMESHCVT=c:\irrbutils\imeshcvt.exe
}}}

*Linux*
if installed to "/home/kmurray/irrbutils", then you would set the following environment variables:

{{{
 IWALKTEST=/home/kmurray/irrbutils/iwalktest
 IMESHCVT=/home/kmurray/irrbutils/imeshcvt
}}}

After the environment variables have been properly set up, you may choose to configure *iwalktest* by tweaking its configuration file "iwalktest.cfg":

{{{
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<options>
    <debug value="1"/>
    <console value="false"/>
    <velocity value="4.0"/>
    <angularvelocity value="100.0"/>
    <maxvertangle value="80.0"/>
    <showcursor value="true"/>
    <loadscene value="/test/scene.irr"/>
    <defcampos value="0 5 -50"/>
    <defcamtarget value="0 0 0"/>
</options>
<renderer>
    <!-- Engine Values:        -->
    <!-- dx9 = DirectX 9       -->
    <!-- ogl = OpenGL          -->
    <engine value="ogl"/>
</renderer>
<filesystems>
    <folder value="c:\scenes\"/>
</filesystems>
<video>
    <bgcolour value="32 0 0"/>
    <fsaa value="false"/>
    <colourdepth value="32"/>
    <fullscreen value="false"/>
    <resolution value="800 600"/>
    <vsync value="true"/>
</video>
<media>
    <fontfolder value="data/fnt/"/>
</media>
<sound>
    <cachelimit value="20"/>
</sound>
<keybindings>
    <key.down.esc value="quit"/>
    <key.down.w value="frwd 1"/>
    <key.up.w value="frwd 0"/>
    <key.down.a value="left 1"/>
    <key.up.a value="left 0"/>
    <key.down.s value="back 1"/>
    <key.up.s value="back 0"/>
    <key.down.d value="rght 1"/>
    <key.up.d value="rght 0"/>
    <key.down.e value="mvup 1"/>
    <key.up.e value="mvup 0"/>
    <key.down.c value="mvdn 1"/>
    <key.up.c value="mvdn 0"/>
    <key.down.right value="rotr 1"/>
    <key.up.right value="rotr 0"/>
    <key.down.left value="rotl 1"/>
    <key.up.left value="rotl 0"/>
    <key.down.up value="rotf 1"/>
    <key.up.up value="rotf 0"/>
    <key.down.down value="rotb 1"/>
    <key.up.down value="rotb 0"/>
    <key.down.lshift value="avel 3.5"/>
    <key.up.lshift value="avel 1.0"/>
    <key.down.i value="invert-mouse"/>
</keybindings>
}}}

*iwalktest* field descriptions:

=== _-options-_ ===

*debug* (int). 
 * The amount of debug information written to "iwalktest.log".

*console* (bool).  
 * Whether or not iwalktest should create a console window that displays debug information.  Windows only.

*velocity* (float). 
 * The camera movement speed in units/second.

*angularvelocity* (float).  
 * The camera rotational speed in ?/second.

*maxvertangle* (float).  
 * The maximum angle (up/down) a camera may rotate to.

*showcursor* (bool).  
 * Whether or not the OS cursor should be visible.  Linux users should leave this set to "false".

*loadscene* (string).  
 * The scene that should be loaded if a scene isn't passed on the command line.

*defcampos* (vector3f).  
 * The initial position of the default camera created by *iwalktest*.

*defcamtarget* (vector3f).  
 * The initial target of the default camera created by *iwalktest*.

=== _-renderer-_ ===

*engine* (string).  
 * The engine to use, "dx9" - DirectX 9, "ogl" - OpenGL.  Windows only.  Linux uses OpenGL.

=== _-filesystems-_ ===

This sections contains the filesystems that iwalktest should load/mount during initialization.  Possible values include:

<folder>, <zipfile>, and/or <pakfile>

=== _-video-_ ===

*bgcolour* (vector3d).  
 * The RGB colour values (0-255) to use for the background colour.

*fsaa* (bool).  
 * Whether or not to use anti-aliasing.  Experimental.

*colourdepth* (int). 
 * The colour depth to use.

*fullscreen* (bool).  
 * Whether or not to run in full screen mode.

*resolution* (int int). 
 * The X,Y screen resolution to use.

*vsync* (bool).  
 * Whether or not to run in vsync mode.

=== _-media-_ ===

*fontfolder* (string).  
 * Used to control the location of the default fonts used by iwalktest.

=== _-sound-_ ===

*cachelimit* (int).  
 * The number of sounds to cache in memory.

=== _-keybindings-_ ===

This section is used for setting up key bindings to "commands" used by *iwalktest*.  These bindings primarily control camera movement.  The defaults are "wasd" for movement and arrow keys for rotation.  The mouse may also be used for rotation.
